formalpara.title: Figure 4. Early pharyngeal development
formalpara.para: Features of pharyngeal development from the 4-cell stage to the 28-cell stage. This period is under control of maternal factors, but transitions to zygotic control with the activation of tbx-35, tbx-37, tbx-38 and pha-4. Left panels show cells and the cell types they produce. Right panels illustrate genetic regulatory relationships. The pharynx is generated from green blastomeres (ABa and EMS at the 4-cell stage). Descendents of green cells that do not produce pharyngeal cells are grey.
